comment.author: 12729007@N00
comment._content: Angleterre manifestation = English event. Does anyone know what's actually going on in this photo? Thanks!

comment.author: 63902959@N00
comment._content: well these are all students of some kind, probably in Islington, London.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: At the left I see "ERINE COURT." I believe the left-hand building is shown in www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=75046 as "ENTRANCE TO CATHERINE COURT AND No. 12, TRINITY SQUARE". www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=75047 shows the same house (one in from left) and the next house is certainly consistent with the view here. So London, not Islington but near the Tower of London. kosheeshka, as a tag indicates "manifestation" can be translated as "demonstration."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A little more research and I think I know what's actually going on. The schoolboys are beating the bounds of the parish. See fullhomelydivinity.org/articles/rogation and ascension.htm which has pictures and a description of the tradition.

comment.author: 72429059@N00
comment._content: See also: www.jamd.com/image/g/3281938 The Tower Liberty is an area around the Tower of London that was historically outside the jurisdiction of the City of London and the local county. They still beat the bounds, but you'll have to wait three years to see it at Tower Hill, though I believe it is still an active tradition in many other English parishes. www.hrp.org.uk/NewsAndMedia/Pressresources/tolpressresour...
